description.narrative: National authorities have increased capacity and evidence to enhance the equity and child focus of the national social protection system.

mailing-address.narrative: UN Street 12 Sukhbaatar District 1st khoroo Ulaanbaatar - 14201

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National authorities have increased capacity and evidence to enhance the equity and child focus of the national social protection system.

description.narrative: Significant progresses have been achieved in preparation and implementation of a pilot aimed at demonstrating that the existing social protection system of the country can respond to the climate related seasonal shocks at a minimum administrative cost, due to its well-established MIS, human resources and the banking system. A pilot programme is also progressing to showcase that through community led initiatives, women and children from the most disadvantaged communities could be better protected from the negative health consequences of air pollution. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: Amount (in national currency) allocated from the national budget to new (or expanded) COVID-19 social protection programmes that directly or indirectly benefit children (including on-budget development partner funds) in the reporting year [COVID]
Evidence of use of budget and impact analyses for improved programme design/targeting

actual.value: 2019:The current PMT is from 2017. The government is planning to revise the PMT methodology and update the Integrated Household Database in 2020. It was agreed with partners that the assessment/evaluation to be conducted for the new PMT.

title.narrative: 1.4 Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF supported capacity development of the NSO and MLSP in conducting multidimensional poverty analyses. Consultations were held involving social sector ministries in preparation for the MDP analyses using the SISS 2018 fresh data to enable the government in monitoring its progress in achieving th

title.narrative: Shock-responsive SP: Shock-responsive SP: Policy/strategy is adapted to support appropriate and timely vertical and/or horizontal expansion expansion of the existing social protection systems during crisis by government and/or humanitarian agencies (Linking with early warning systems, climate change and resilience building policies, contingency budgeting and financing etc.)
